items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible today, Monday 3 November.

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. River levels will remain high over the next couple of days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Tuesday 4 November 2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: County Durham, Darlington, North Yorkshire, Westmorland and Furness

items.message:
Forecast high river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 04 November 2025 . 
Further rainfall is forecast this morning, river levels will remain elevated through this afternoon. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 7:00PM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message: River levels remain high and may lead to flooding this morning. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the rivers Duddon, Crake, Mill Beck and other watercourses from Coniston to Barrow-in-Furness including low lying areas around Ulpha, Duddon Bridge, Broughton in Furness, Kirkby-in-Furness, Dalton in Furness and Ulverston. Further rainfall is expected this morning, Tuesday 4 November. This may cause river levels to rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 05:00PM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen and are forecast to rise again today and overnight.  Flooding is possible on over the next two days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Predicted peaks:- Llanymynech 3.9m to 4.2m on 05/11 AM. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  This message will be updated by 7:00 PM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Lancashire, North Yorkshire, Westmorland and Furness

items.message:
Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the early hours of 04 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near to the river Lune, Conder and Keer and other watercourses from Kirkby Lonsdale to Galgate including Gressingham, Carnforth, Hornby, Wray, Bentham and Lancaster. 
We are clearing blockages from debris screens and closely monitoring the situation. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible throughout today and into this evening. Locations most affected will be areas surrounding Widdale Beck near the A684, and Brunt Acres Road north of Hawes. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. We are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated by 8pm, Tuesday 4th November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high following rainfall overnight and may lead to flooding this morning around the rivers Kent, Bela and other watercourses, from Kentmere to Silverdale including low lying areas around Staveley, Burneside, Kendal, Milnthorpe and Beetham.. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Further rainfall is expected this morning, Tuesday 4th November. This may cause river levels to rise further. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 05:00PM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and closely monitoring the situation. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.

Flooding is possible from the early hours of 04 November 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Further rainfall is expected this morning, Tuesday 4 November. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near to the river Lune, Rawthey, Dee and other watercourses from Tebay to Kirkby Lonsdale including Sedbergh and Killington.

Never drive through flood water, just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car . 
This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Eden at Carlisle, Rickerby Park, Swifts and Stoneyholme Golf Courses
items.message:
High river levels are expected to cause flooding today. 
Flooding is expected on 04 November 2025 from 09:30AM. 
Locations most affected will be low lying roads, car parks, public spaces and recreational facilities at Rickerby Park, Swifts and Stoneyholme Golf Courses. 
We are closely monitoring the situation  
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water  
This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water  
This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: High river and lake levels today have led to flooding. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. Another heavy band of rain is expected this morning, Tuesday 4th November. This will cause levels to rise further and could result in us issuing further flood warnings. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 05:00PM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

The Cocker from Crummock Water to Cockermouth. River Marron from Ullock to its confluence with the Derwent near Bridgefoot. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. items.description: River Greta at Keswick, Keswick Campsite, Rugby Club and Quinta
items.message: Rising river levels are expected to cause flooding this morning. Flooding is expected on 04 November 2025 from 4:30AM. Locations most affected will be low lying land next to the river Greta and Derwent Water. We expect the rain to ease off after 12PM on Tuesday 04 November with the river levels peaking below 3m, at Keswick Campsite gauging station, before lunchtime. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
